title: Michael Shiuming Truong
text:
I am a 4th year PhD student in the Quantitative Methods program of the Department of Psychology at York University, supervised by Dr. Ji Yeh Choi.
I am interested in the powerful and insightful application of quantitative analysis towards psychological data for scientific purposes.
My research currently focuses on:

The effects of cluster size in multilevel/hierarchical models
The development of fast and robust Integrated Generalized Structured Component Analysis Trees (IGSCA-Trees) in the R package cSEM
Using philosophy of science, psychology and statistics to provide a justification for the application of machine-learning structural equation modeling methods called ‘Falsificatory Data Analysis’

Please feel free to reach out to me!
